bioghist.p: The Keystone View Co. was formed in 1892 in Meadville, Pennsylvania by B.L. Singley, a former salesman at Underwood & Underwood. This company was a major publisher of stereographs. In 1898 they organized an Education Department which produced boxed sets for school instruction with images and descriptive text illustrating culture, industry, commerce and politics. Although the company hired its own professional photographers, they also purchased rights to other negatives including several series of Underwood and Underwood negatives in 1912. Orders for Keystone sets continued to be filled by the company as late as 1970.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of 599 black and white and color lantern slide transparencies with accompanying text cards. Topics include American scenery, Indians of the West, manufacturing, agriculture, trades and crafts, buildings, Cuba, Alaska, Canada, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Panama, polar exploration, South America, West Indies, Great Britain, Europe, Middle East, the Orient, Africa, and heavenly bodies. The set of slides is nearly complete, missing only slide #39.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
